definition: husband and wife (literary)
spouse/big and tall/strong/robust/upright and outspoken
husband and wife
married couple very much in love/deep conjugal love

sentences.english: Two pairs of lovers coupled in wedlock in our company last week.
sentences.chinese: 上周我们公司两对情人结为伉俪。

sentences.english: Premier and Mrs. Yu had fun watching the monkeys on a trip to Leofoo Village Safari Park.
sentences.chinese: 贤伉俪于六福村野生动物园与人猿同乐。

sentences.english: Do your children see you and your spouse being  affectionate with one another?
sentences.chinese: 你的孩子看到了你们伉俪彼此鹣鲽情深的样子吗？

sentences.english: Now he and his wife would be called the 10)Duke and 11)Duchess of Windsor.
sentences.chinese: 现在他和妻子被称为温莎公爵伉俪。

sentences.english: We all respect the wish of Prof and Mrs Kao for a return to a quiet and undisturbed life.
sentences.chinese: 我们尊重高锟教授伉俪回复平静生活的意愿。

sentences.english: Now he and his wife would be called the Duke and Duchess of Windsor.
sentences.chinese: 现在他和妻子被称为温莎公爵伉俪。

sentences.english: The royal couple appeared in splendid array.
sentences.chinese: 王室伉俪身穿艳服出现。

sentences.english: A year after we met, we married.
sentences.chinese: 认识一年之后，我们喜结伉俪。

definition: married couple very much in love/deep conjugal love
a (married) couple/husband and wife/CL:對|对[dui4]
to tie the knot (idiom)/to get married
story or deed that captures the imagination and is spread far and wide
fig. the man sings and the woman follows/fig. marital harmony
in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony
husband and wife/married couple
friends despite the difference in age
happily married couple
love is more solid than gold (idiom)
anecdote passed on with approbation
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
newlyweds
to get to know each other/acquaintance
talented man and beautiful woman/ideal couple
string of pearl and jade (idiom); ideal combination/perfect pair
